required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Calorie-restricted Diet and Exercise Intervention vs Exercise Control on the Knee Function Outcomes of Metabolic Syndrome Patients With Degenerate Meniscus Tears at 1 Year Follow up

lead_sponsor.agency: The First People's Hospital of Jingzhou

clinical_study.source: The First People's Hospital of Jingzhou

brief_summary.textblock: Calorie-restricted(CR) diet and exercise were effective to reduce Metabolic syndrome(MetS), however, its effect on knee functions for MetS patients with degenerate meniscus tears(DMTs) was still poorly investigated.

detailed_description.textblock:
The CR diet and exercise group received a balanced diet with an energy consists carbohydrates 45-65%; fat 20-35%; and protein 10- 35% and a deficit of 600 kcal/day from their daily energy requirement [23]. The energy intake per day of the calorie restricted diet was calculated based on the detailed composition of meals such as rice, vegetables, eggs, pork, and beef, using the Chinese food composition tables[24]. Our diets were cooked with traditional Chinese cooking methods such as boiling, stir-frying, and stewing. During the intervention, other lipid-lowering drugs were not allowed to intake supplement as it alters the outcome. Participants were guided by a dietitian for modulations of their caloric intake weekly for six months.
The exercise intervention consists of aerobic exercises and resistance exercise, flexibility exercises about 150 minutes for≥2 d•wk for six months. The aerobic exercises included walking on a treadmill, stationary cycling for at least 30 minutes for≥2 d•wk, while, resistance exercises included nine upper-extremity and lower-extremity exercise with weighting lift machines for ≥2 d•wk, while, flexibility exercise including the major muscle-tendon groups (a total of 60 s per exercise) for ≥2 d•wk. Participants performed 1 or 2 sets with 8-12 repetitions of each exercise. The exercise sessions were monitored by telephone video. Calorie restricted diet and exercise group contain both the above intervention for 6 months.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.description: the questionnaires of the Knee injury and Osteoarthritis Outcome Score (KOOS) subscales
the International Knee Documentation Committee Subjective Knee Evaluation Form (IKDC) score

secondary_outcome.description: Secondary outcomes include five subscales of the KOOS covered pain, symptoms, activity of daily living, sport and recreational function, and knee related quality of life
Secondary outcomes include five subscales of the KOOS covered pain, symptoms, activity of daily living, sport and recreational function, and knee related quality of life

arm_group.arm_group_label: Calorie restricted diet and excecise intervention
arm_group.description: The CR diet and exercise group received a balanced diet with an energy consists carbohydrates 45-65%; fat 20-35%; and protein 10- 35% and a deficit of 600 kcal/day from their daily energy requirement [23]. Participants were guided by a dietitian for modulations of their caloric intake weekly for six months. The exercise intervention consists of aerobic exercises and resistance exercise, flexibility exercises about 150 minutes for≥2 d•wk for six months. Calorie restricted diet and exercise group contain both the above intervention for 6 months.
participants then underwent libitum diet and the same exercise intervention during the program

intervention.description: The CR diet and exercise group received a balanced diet with an energy consists carbohydrates 45-65%; fat 20-35%; and protein 10- 35% and a deficit of 600 kcal/day from their daily energy requirement.The exercise intervention consists of aerobic exercises and resistance exercise, flexibility exercises about 150 minutes for≥2 d•wk for six months. The aerobic exercises included walking on a treadmill, stationary cycling for at least 30 minutes for≥2 d•wk, while, resistance exercises included nine upper-extremity and lower-extremity exercise with weighting lift machines for ≥2 d•wk, while, flexibility exercise including the major muscle-tendon groups (a total of 60 s per exercise) for ≥2 d•wk. Participants performed 1 or 2 sets with 8-12 repetitions of each exercise. The exercise sessions were monitored by telephone video.
intervention.arm_group_label: Calorie restricted diet and excecise intervention
